page.title: 17Transport.
page.content: Since its beginings,Newport has been well served by transport routes.First there was the canal. Then the main road and finally,at the northern end of the village, was a station where trains running on the Hull and Barnsley railway line stopped. Time has changed these early travelling methods.The canal is no longer used and the railway was closed in the 1950's when the lack of coal export made it uneconomical.The road system has also changed dramatically. Eight years ago the M62 motorway was opened. This meant that three quarters of the traffic that used to pass through the village of Newport, was taken on the new motorway by-pass. For those people without cars, the village is served by a regular bus service.
